{{also|vör|voer|Voer|VOR|vor-|вор}} ==English== ===Etymology=== See {{m|en|for}}. ===Preposition=== {{en-prep}} # {{eye dialect of|en|for}} #* '''c. 1606''', {{w|William Shakespeare}}, ''{{w|King Lear}}'', Act 4, Scene 6: #*: Edgar: Ch'ill pick your teeth, zir: come; no matter '''vor''' your foins. #* {{quote-journal|en|1853, May 20|anonymous|Self-sustenance; or, the Lost Pet|Punch|http://www.worldcat.org/title/punch/oclc/263593370|209|I zays enough to make thee grin: / Thee doesn't look '''vor''' much good out o'n.}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=orv|ROV|RVO}} ---- ==Cornish== ===Noun=== {{head|kw|mutated noun}} # {{soft mutation of|kw|mor}} ---- ==Czech== ===Pronunciation=== * {{cs-IPA}} ===Noun=== {{cs-noun|m}} # [[raft]] [[Category:cs:Watercraft]] ---- ==Danish== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|da|/vɔr/|[vɒ]}} ===Pronoun=== {{head|da|pronoun|neuter|vort|plural|vore}} # {{lb|da|formal}} [[our]], [[ours]] ====Synonyms==== * {{l|da|vores}} ====See also==== {{Danish personal pronouns}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|}}, from {{inh|de|goh|fora}}, ultimately from {{inh|de|ine-pro|*per-}}. Cognate with {{cog|nl|voor}}. Compare {{cog|en|fore}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/foːɐ̯/}} * {{rhymes|de|oːɐ̯}} * {{audio|de|De-vor.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-vor.ogg|audio (Austria)}} * {{homophones|de|Fort}} ===Preposition=== {{de-prep}} # {{l|en|before}}, {{l|en|prior to}} # {{l|en|ahead of}}, {{l|en|in front of}} # {{l|en|ago}} #: {{uxi|de|'''vor''' drei Tagen|three days ago}} # {{l|en|because of}} ====Usage notes==== The preposition ''vor'' is used with accusative case if the verb shows movement from one place to another, whereas it is used with dative case if the verb shows location. ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|vor allem}} * ('''''vor''' + dem'') {{l|de|vorm}} * ('''''vor''' + das'') {{l|de|vors}} ---- ==Icelandic== {{wikipedia|lang=is}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|is|/vɔːr/}} * {{rhymes|is|ɔːr}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|is|non|vár}}. ====Noun==== {{is-noun|n|vors|vor}} # the season [[spring]] =====Declension===== {{is-decl-noun-n-s|v|o|r}} =====Synonyms===== * {{sense|spring}} {{l|is|vortími|g=n}} =====See also===== {{table:seasons/is}} ===Etymology 2=== From {{inh|is|non|várr}}. ====Determiner==== {{head|is|determiner|cat2=possessive determiners}} # {{lb|is|formal}} [[our]], [[ours]] #: {{ux|is|Mannorð '''vort''' liggur við.|'''Our''' reputation is at stake.}} =====Derived terms===== * {{l|is|faðirvor}} ===Etymology 3=== See {{m|is|vér}}. ====Pronoun==== {{head|is|pronoun form}} # {{inflection of|is|vér||gen}} =====Declension===== {{is-decl-formal-ppron-table}} ---- ==Romanian== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|ro|/vor/}} ===Verb=== {{head|ro|verb form}} # {{verb form of|ro|vrea||3p|pres|ind}} #: {{ux|ro|[[ce]] '''vor''' [[să]] [[fac]] [[eu]]?|what do they want me to do?}} ===Verb=== {{ro-aux|vrea|person=3p|tense=f}} # (they) [[will]] #: ''[[bănuiesc]] [[că]] '''vor''' [[vrea]] [[să]] [[fac]] [[eu]] [[ceva]] [[pentru]] [[ei]]'' #:: I guess they will want me to do something for them ---- ==Yola== ===Preposition=== {{head|yol|preposition}} # [[for]]
